title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 244.3 - CSAPR NO[x] Annual Trading Program budgets
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 244.3 - CSAPR NO[x] Annual Trading Program budgets

State Regulations
(a) The CSAPR NO
x

Annual Trading Program budget for the 2017 control period and beyond is defined
in
40
CFR
97.410(a)(14)(iv)
(see

Table 1, section 200.9 of this title)
(b) The department will allocate allowances
in whole ton increments from the CSAPR NO
x

Annual

Trading Program budgets for the 2017 control period and beyond in the following
manner: (1)

Five percent of the CSAPR
NO
x

Annual Trading Program budget will be allocated to
the new unit set-aside account. (2)

Allowances totaling the average emissions for the three most recent calendar
years of all CSAPR NO
x

Annual units in New York State
for which at least three full calendar years of emissions data are available
before the allocation submission deadline for the control period under section
244.4
of this part will be
proportionally allocated to each of such individual CSAPR
NO
x

Annual units. For purposes of this paragraph, emissions data indicating zero emissions will be deemed available for a unit
for any reporting period for which the unit either reports zero emissions or
does not report emissions data after being required to report emissions data
for that reporting period or a previous reporting period. (3)

After the department allocates based on
paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subdivision, the EERET account will receive the
remainder of allowances from the CSAPR NO
x

Annual

Trading Program budget except any allowances reserved for an Indian country new
unit set-aside under
40
CFR
97.410(a) (14)(vi)
(see

Table 1, section 200.9 of this title). (i) The
EERET account will be allocated a minimum of 10 percent of the CSAPR
NO
x

Annual Trading Program budget. (ii)

If paragraphs (1)-(3) of this
subdivision result in an EERET account allocation of less than 10 percent of
the CSAPR NO
x

Annual Trading Program budget, the
allowances allocated under paragraph (2) of this subdivision will be reduced
proportionally by the amounts necessary to ensure that 10 percent of the CSAPR
NO
x

Annual Trading Program budget is allocated to the
EERET account. Notes
